mainIssueGroups.description: Multiple TypeScript errors related to Clerk auth() API changes - properties like userId, sessionId are now Promises
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Update all auth() calls to use await since they now return Promises

mainIssueGroups.description: Jest DOM matchers not properly configured (toBeInTheDocument, toHaveAttribute, etc.)
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Import '@testing-library/jest-dom' in jest.setup.js or add proper type definitions

mainIssueGroups.description: Clerk UserResource type doesn't have 'email' and 'name' properties directly
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Access email via user.emailAddresses[0].emailAddress and name via user.firstName/lastName

mainIssueGroups.description: Badge component variant 'success' not in allowed types
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Change 'success' variant to 'default' or update Badge component types

mainIssueGroups.description: Next.js 15 route params are now Promises and need await
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Add await when accessing params.applicationId, params.jobId, etc.

mainIssueGroups.description: Various implicit 'any' types and missing type annotations
mainIssueGroups.suggestedFix: Add proper type annotations for parameters

recommendations: Priority 1: Fix Clerk auth() Promise issues - these could cause runtime errors
Priority 2: Fix route params Promise issues - Next.js 15 breaking change
Priority 3: Update UserResource property access for Clerk compatibility
Priority 4: Configure Jest DOM matchers for tests
Priority 5: Fix remaining type annotations and implicit 'any' types
notes: Build succeeds but TypeScript has 186 warnings. Most are related to recent framework updates (Next.js 15, Clerk v5). No critical runtime issues detected.
